The seventh-inning stretch is a tradition in baseball that takes place between the halves of the seventh inning of a game. During the stretch, spectators traditionally stand up, stretch, and perhaps get a refreshment.

The seventh-inning stretch is a tradition that takes place in the middle of the seventh inning of a baseball game in which the crowd stands up and stretches their arms and legs, often accompanied by the playing of the song "Take Me Out to the Ball Game".
